definition: to cling without letting go/to pester without end/to cling lovingly to each other

sentences.english: Lobbyists in Washington have been delighted by all this new activity.

sentences.english: The idea that she will go abroad for further study made herself excited.
sentences.chinese: 她一想到就要出國深造，激動不已。

sentences.english: The beautiful silks and velvets surprised him very much.

sentences.english: We were amazed. We had never seen flowers in the snow.

sentences.english: I was touched by the culture belt between China and Japan.

sentences.english: The world is in continuous flux and is impermanent .
sentences.chinese: 世界變遷不已，並非是常久不變的。

sentences.english: Her handling of the crisis fills me _with__admiration_.

definition: to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
